business.headline: Sensex gains 1,500 points on US rate cut optimism; Granules India tanks 17%The S&P BSE Sensex was up 1,439.55 points to 82,962.71 at the closing bell, while the NSE Nifty50 gained nearly 470.45 points to settle at 25,388.90.

Explained: Why Granules India shares crashed nearly 17% todayGranules India stock price: With this drop, the stock now trades roughly 22% below its all-time high of Rs 724.55, reached earlier in the month

PwC to cut 1,800 jobs in first major layoff since 2009The layoff affects approximately 2.5% of the company's US workforce and impacts a range of positions, including associates, managing directors, and employees in business services, audit, and tax departments.

Petrol, diesel prices may fall if crude oil rates remain low: ReportCrude oil prices have recently dropped to their lowest point in nearly three years, bringing some hope for lower fuel prices.

Ayushman Bharat: Senior citizens aged 70 and above to get these benefitsAyushman Bharat: The expansion aims to ease the financial burden of healthcare for the elderly, who often face high medical expenses.

HDFC Bank in talks with global banks to sell loans worth Rs 8,400 crore: ReportFor HDFC Bank, offloading these loans would help improve that ratio, which has deteriorated as credit growth has outpaced deposit accumulation in recent years.

Kross Limited IPO allotment: Step-by-step guide to check statusKross Limited IPO allotment: Investors who applied for the IPO can check their allotment status online through the BSE portal or on Kfin Technologies Limited, the registrar for the issue.

Explained: Why everyone wants a piece of Bajaj Housing Finance IPOBoth big and small, investors rushed in to grab their share of this Rs 6,560-crore IPO, which has attracted a whopping Rs 3.2 lakh crore in bids.

Zomato shares jump 4% to hit all-time high. Will it gain further? Zomato shares hit a record high of Rs 283.50 on the Bombay Stock Exchange. Can the stock continue its upward streak? Read on to find out.

Ayushman Bharat to cover senior citizens above 70: All you need to knowThe expansion of the Ayushman Bharat scheme aims to address the healthcare needs of the elderly, who often face higher medical expenses as they age.

Bajaj Housing Finance IPO sees Rs 3.2 lakh crore bids, GMP crosses 100%Bajaj Housing Finance IPO: Before the public issue, Bajaj Housing Finance managed to raise Rs 1,758 crore from 104 anchor investors.

New toll collection explained: How GNSS will change your highway experienceUnder the new rules, the GNSS will automatically grant exemptions for travel up to 20 km per day, charging toll fees only for the distance travelled beyond this limit.

Thematic mutual funds explained: Are they the right bet for investors?Thematic funds have outpaced traditional categories in popularity. But what are they, and why are AMCs launching so many? Here's what you need to know.

Mutual funds sahi hai? Why so many Indians are betting big on SIPsIt took 50 years to build Rs 10 lakh crore in AUM from 1963 to 2013, but in just six more years, it reached Rs 23 lakh crore by 2019. As of August 2024, the AUM has tripled to Rs 66.70 lakh crore, demonstrating strong investor confidence.

Sensex dips 400 points, Nifty ends below 25,000; Tata Motors tanks 6%The S&P BSE Sensex fell 398.13 points to 81,523.16 at the closing bell, while the NSE Nifty50 declined 122.65 points to settle at 24,918.45.

Samsung plans global job cuts up to 30%, 1,000 layoffs likely in India: Report In India, Samsung has already begun offering severance packages to mid-level employees, with up to 1,000 jobs expected to be affected.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: PM Modi at Chief Justice's home for Ganpati Puja sparks rowTop government sources told India Today that the CJI had sent invites to several dignitaries, including the Prime Minister, for the Ganpati Puja.

Extremely worrying: Rahul Gandhi condemns attack on Army officers, rape of friendRahul Gandhi and Priyanka Gandhi Vadra have criticised the BJP for its handling of law and order, following an attack on two Army officers and the rape of one of their friends in Madhya Pradesh.
Semi-naked, headless body of woman found on Kanpur-Delhi highwayUttar Pradesh Police said the woman's bones and teeth were broken. The police are yet to make a breakthrough in the case.
Sensex surges 1,000 points, Nifty rises; investors add Rs 5 lakh croreThe S&P BSE Sensex added1048.49 points to 82,571.65, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 343.65 points to 25,262.10.

LIVE: Polaris Dawn astronauts to exit Dragon for record spacewalkPolaris Dawn Mission LIVE: The Polaris Dawn crew, consisting of four civilian astronauts led by billionaire Jared Isaacman, is set to create history as they conduct the world's first private spacewalk.

Farooq Abdullah jabs BJP on IC 814 hijack: Told them not to release terroristsFarooq Abdullah was Chief Minister of Jammu and Kashmir when the Delhi-bound IC 814 was hijacked in December 1999. As per the demands of the hijackers, the Centre released terrorists Maulana Masood Azhar, Ahmed Omar Saeed Sheikh, and Mushtaq Ahmed Zargar.

Internet roasts Narayana Murthy again for his 'insights' on good parentingNarayana Murthy said that parents are responsible for creating a disciplined environment at home for children to study. His statement has triggered the internet.

No live telecast, 15-member delegation: Bengal invites doctors for 5 pm meetThe letter written by West Bengal Chief Secretary Manoj Pant accepted the doctors' demand for Mamata Banerjee's presence at the meeting, but rejected their prerequisite of a live telecast of the talks.

Can the Chief Justice of India be influenced so easily?Prime Minister Narendra Modi visited Chief Justice of India DY Chandrachud's residence for Ganpati puja. Shiv Sena (UBT) leader attacked the CJI's credibility over the meeting. Does the thick line separating the judiciary and the executive get blurred if the CJI meets the PM at a social or religious event?

Company challenges suspension of eye drops claiming to replace reading glassesEntod Pharmaceuticals denies making false claims about their new PresVu eye drops and plans to challenge the suspension by the Drugs Controller General of India of its manufacturing and sales permission in court.

PM Modi hosts Paralympic heroes, Avani Lekhara gifts shirt with special messagePrime Minister Narendra Modi hosted the Indian Paralympians on Thursday, September 12 at his residence. PM Modi interacted with medalists and posed for photos. Shooter Avani Lekhara gifted the Prime Minister a signed shirt with a 'thank you' message.

PwC to cut 1,800 jobs in first major layoff since 2009The layoff affects approximately 2.5% of the company's US workforce and impacts a range of positions, including associates, managing directors, and employees in business services, audit, and tax departments.

Viral video: Golden Retriever's hilarious reaction to Trump's 'dog was eaten' remarkA Golden Retriever's reaction to Donald Trump's claim, that dogs are being eaten by immigrants in Springfield, Ohio, has gone viral on social media.

Indian Hockey team secure semi-finals spot after 3-1 win over KoreaIndia continued their dominant run in the Asian Champions Trophy, securing a 3-1 victory over Korea and securing a spot in the semi-finals. The defending champions, led by Harmanpreet Singh, remain unbeaten, setting the stage for a crucial clash against Pakistan.
What American astronaut saw from space moments after the 9/11 attacksHis initial reaction was not just one of shock, but a profound sense of witnessing history from a place very few could imagine.

Being customers in bar where women are dancing not obscene: Bombay High CourtA two-judge bench of the Bombay High Court quashed a case against a man who was arrested by the Mumbai for allegedly watching women dance at a bar.

Anil Mehta's last words to daughter Malaika before his death: I'm sick and tiredAnil Mehta, 65, died on Wednesday morning by jumping from the sixth-floor balcony of his residence in Bandra. Mehta's wife, Joyce Polycarp, was in their flat at Ayesha Manor in Bandra when the incident took place.

Manipur Police has procured machine guns, but why?Manipur Police has procured 7.62 mm medium machine guns (MMGs) and requested the Army to train its personnel in their use. The procurement, amid rising drone and missile attacks by militants on civilians, raises questions about why the Manipur Police is getting armed with a weapon not generally used by the police or paramilitary forces.

Army officers thrashed, woman friend gang-raped in Madhya PradeshThe incident happened when the two Major rank officers, who were undergoing training at Army War College in Madhya Pradesh's Mhow, were out on a picnic with their two female friends on September 11.

Stress is good for sperm. A new study says soA new study reveals that stress impacts sperm motility, or its ability to move through the female reproductive system to fertilise an egg.

Autopsy reveals actor Malaika Arora's father died of multiple injuries: Police sourcesSpeaking to India Today TV, the police sources, citing the autopsy report, said that the father of actor-model Malaika Arora died due to multiple injuries.

Bangladesh asks Hindus to pause Durga Puja music during namaz, azanBangladesh's Home Affairs Adviser said that the local puja committees have been asked to avoid playing musical instruments during azan and namaz, adding that organisers have agreed to the request.

Why cat-saviour Trump can't stand cat-lady TaylorThe 2024 US presidential election has turned into a catfight of sorts. While Donald Trump spoke of a cat-eating population in the US, Taylor Swift called herself a "cat-lady" in her endorsement note for Kamala Harris. But here's why "cat-saviour" Trump is not a fan of the "cat-lady" pop singer.

76th Primetime Emmys: When and where to watch in IndiaThe 2024 Primetime Emmy Awards will be held at the Peacock Theatre in Los Angeles on September 15, celebrating excellence in television. It will be streamed live in India on Lionsgate Play on September 16 at 5 am IST.

BTS' J-Hope teases collab with Pharell Williams: Can't wait for 2025BTS' J-Hope has sparked excitement among fans with a hint of a 2025 collaboration with Pharrell Williams. The Instagram post has generated significant buzz.

Vicky Vidya Ka Woh Wala Video trailer: A hilarious mix of chaos and confusionThe trailer of Rajkummar Rao and Triptii Dimri's upcoming film, Vicky Vidya Ka Woh Wala Video, was released today, September 12. The film is touted to be a family entertainer.

Watch: Vicky Kaushal seeks blessings at Lalbaugcha RajaActor Vicky Kaushal recently offered prayers at Lalbaugcha Raja. A video of the actor walking up barefoot to the 'pandaal' for 'darshan' has emerged online.

sports.headline: ISL 2024 fixtures, teams, players to look out for: All you need to knowThe 2024-2025 ISL season kicks off on September 13, featuring exciting matchups, new teams, and rising stars. Defending champions Mumbai City FC face Mohunbagan Super Giants in a highly anticipated opener.

AFG vs SA: Rashid Khan returns as Afghanistan pick new faces for ODI seriesStar all-rounder Rashid Khan makes a return as Afghanistan announce their squad for the upcoming ODI series against South Africa on September 12. Rashid last played in the T20 World Cup.

Thank you for your support: PM Modi receives signed shirt from Paralympic heroesParis Paralympics: Prime Minister Narendra Modi was gifted a special shirt by India's Paralympic heroes, who thanked him for the government's support. PM Modi hosted India's champion para-athletes at his residence in New Delhi on September 12. India won a record-breaking tally of 29 medals at the Paralympics.

Tottenham Hotspur's Bentancur charged by FA over Son Heung-min commentsThe Football Association (FA) has charged Tottenham Hotspur's Rodrigo Bentancur for improper comments about teammate Son Heung-min. Bentancur apologised, but the FA cited an aggravated breach involving race and nationality.

Despite twisting ankle, Tom Banton limps out to bat in heroic effortSomerset batter Tom Banton came out to bat with a twisted ankle as his team was looking to fight against Surrey in the Championship Division One match in Taunton.

Competing with McGurk, Matt Short keen on taking David Warner's spot in T20I sideEngland vs Australia: Seasoned opener Matthew Short said he is looking forward to making the most of the opportunities at the opening spot. Short, who hit 41 off just 26 balls in a whirlwind 86-run stand with Travis Head on Wednesday, is competing with young sensation Jake Fraser-McGurk for the opening role.

Ruturaj Gaikwad retires hurt after twisting his ankle in Duleep Trophy matchDuleep Trophy 2024: India C captain Ruturaj Gaikwad retired hurt after twisting his left ankle while batting against India B. Gaikwad could manage to face only two balls before departing.

Chess Olympiad: Praggnanandhaa, Vaishali star as Indian teams start strongChess Olympiad 2024: D Gukesh and Harika sat out of the opening round, but India men's and women's teams did not have any trouble winning their opening round ties in Budapest.

Ronaldo's advice to Ten Hag for United rebuild: Talk to Van NistelrooyCristiano Ronaldo reignites tension with Erik ten Hag, advising the Manchester United coach to seek guidance from Ruud van Nistelrooy while questioning his readiness to compete at the top level, despite expressing love for the club.

Greater Noida Test set to join rare list after rain washes out 4th day Afghanistan (AFG) vs New Zealand (NZ), one-off Test: Rain washed out the fourth successive day of the Test match in Greater Noida. The one-off match is heading towards a rare abandonment without a ball bowled.

Bangladesh announce squad for India Tests, show faith in Pakistan-beating unitThe Bangladesh Cricket Board announced a 16-member squad for the 2-match Test series against India, starting September 19. The BCB showcased faith in the Pakistan-beating unit for the Test series against India.

Kohli's captaincy played big role in Indian cricket's turnaround: Ricky PontingRicky Ponting praised Virat Kohli for revolutionizing Indian Test cricket, emphasizing his crucial role in transforming the team's mindset and leadership. Kohli's tenure as captain from 2014 to 2022 led India to notable overseas victories, including a historic series win in Australia.

18-year-old Caity becomes youngest women's world champ in surfingCaity Simmers, just 18 years old, made history as the youngest women's world surfing champion after defeating Olympic gold medallist Caroline Marks at the 2024 World Surf League Finals.

Unstoppable Sinner will make things difficult for Alcaraz: Toni NadalToni Nadal praised World No. 1 Jannik Sinner as "practically unstoppable" after his US Open win but warned that Carlos Alcaraz might struggle to match Sinner's rising dominance, particularly on the mental front.

Watch: Shubman Gill training hard in gym ahead of IND vs BAN Test seriesShubman Gill was gearing up for the upcoming home Test season as he sweated it out in the gym. He will feature in India's squad for the 2-match Test series vs Bangladesh.

Bangladesh makes Test debut vs India: Dhaka witnesses historyIND vs BAN: Bangladesh made their Test debut back in 2000 under Naimur Rahman Durjoy and lost to India by nine wickets at the Bangabandhu Stadium in Dhaka.

Vinicus apologises for Brazil defeat, addresses Real Madrid comparisons Vinicius Junior apologized to fans after Brazil's defeat to Paraguay, acknowledging their poor form in the World Cup Qualifiers. He promised to improve, facing pressure to lead Brazil back to success in upcoming matches.

R Ashwin begins hunt of Glenn McGrath, Nathan Lyon's records in Bangladesh TestsLegendary India spinner R Ashwin will resume his international season with the Test series against Bangladesh. Ashwin, who has 516 wickets to his name has been the standout bowler at home in recent years.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.

WC influential ten: Writers community honors digital social change makersWriters Community Freelancers Releases 'WC Influential Ten' List Recognizing Social Impact through Virtual Space and Social Media
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
